tutorial.title:
Bond Valuation
(Semiannual Interest)
tutorial.scenario:
A company has issued twenty-year semiannual bonds with a face value of $1,000. If the annual coupon rate is 10% and the current yield to maturity is 7.5%, what is the firms's current price per bond?

Play
tutorial.step: Press the RESET button to clear all the previous entries.
Enter the number of periods (in this case 40, since the bonds pay semiannual interest), and then press the N button.
Enter the semiannual coupon payment (in this case 50, since the bonds pay semiannual interest), and then press the +/- button followed by the PMT button.
Enter the face value of the bond (in this case 1000), and then press the +/- button followed by the FV button.
Enter the semiannual yield to maturity (in this case 7.5/2, since the bonds pay semiannual interest), and then press the = button followed by the I/Y button.
Press the CPT button and then the PV button to find the firmâ€™s current price per bond.
